thread.title_full: America fortune cookie writer predicted Powerball quits | Daily Mail Online

author: Forrest Hanson For Dailymail.Com
title: America fortune cookie writer predicted Powerball quits | Daily Mail Online
text: Didn't see that coming: America's top fortune cookie writer who predicted Powerball numbers quits after 30 years because he's suffering from writer's block Donald Lau, 68, had been 'Chief Fortune Writer' at Wonton Food for 30 years Now has writer's block and is passing the duty on to James Wong. Lau will continue as company's CFO Wong, 43 is the nephew of the New York City-based company's founder Wonton Food produces 4.5million fortune cookies each day In 2005 Wonton Food was investigated after 110 Powerball players won a combined total of $19million with the fortunes's 'lucky numbers' Published: 14:46 GMT, 14 February 2017 | Updated: 13:35 GMT, 17 February 2017 152 shares
